SCM293.name: Cooperative Education for Business Students
SCM293.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM293.description: Integration of pre-professional educational employment experiences in industry and government with knowledge and processes taught in the student's academic program. Educational employment assignment approved by the Department of Supply Chain Management.

SCM303.name: Introduction to Supply Chain Management
SCM303.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM303.description: Objectives, processes, and functions of supply chain management activities including procurement, manufacturing, and logistics. The role of supply chain processes in creating competitive advantage with respect to quality, flexibility, lead-time, and cost.
SCM303.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Accounting major or in the Finance Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

SCM304.name: Survey of Supply Chain Management
SCM304.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM304.description: Objectives, processes, and functions of supply chain management activities including procurement, manufacturing, and logistics. The role of supply chain processes in creating competitive advantage with respect to quality, flexibility, lead-time, and cost.
SCM304.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors and not open to students in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Business-Preference major or in the Finance Major or in the Hospitality Business Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM371.name: Procurement and Supply Management
SCM371.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM371.description: Strategic issues in procurement and supply management. Purchasing process, procurement cycle, purchasing research, relationships with suppliers, negotiation, and commodity planning. Cost, price, and value analysis.
SCM371.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major or in the Sales Leadership Minor or approval of department.

SCM372.name: Manufacturing Planning and Control
SCM372.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM372.description: Production planning, demand management, master scheduling, materials requirements, and capacity planning. Shop floor control, computer-integrated manufacturing, and just-in-time systems.
SCM372.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major or approval of department.

SCM373.name: Logistics and Transportation Management
SCM373.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM373.description: Microanalysis of logistics and transportation services. Customer service, distribution operations, purchasing, order processing, facility design and operations, carrier selection, transportation costing, and negotiation.
SCM373.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

SCM393.name: Introduction to International Business
SCM393.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM393.description: Introduction to the context of international business delivered on-site in foreign settings. Fundamental concepts and principles of globalization such as multinational corporations, foreign markets and economies, internal and external market transactions, international law, cultural influences, and multinational business strategies.
SCM393.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the School of Hospitality Business.

SCM460.name: Procurement Contracting
SCM460.description: Workshop in procurement contracting including terms and conditions, legal terms and conditions, and contracting negotiation
SCM460.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM461.name: Customs, Compliance and Security
SCM461.description: Workshop in customs including the role of customs and border protection, supply security programs, export programs and tariffs, brokers, and trusted traders.
SCM461.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM462.name: End-to-End Supply Chain Management Simulation
SCM462.description: Simulation exercise and competition in the design and operation of global supply chains
SCM462.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM463.name: Supply Chain Enterprise Resource Planning Applications
SCM463.description: Workshop with hands-on experience in enterprise resource planning applications.
SCM463.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM470.name: Supply Chain Application and Policy (W)
SCM470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM470.description: Analysis and problem solving of supply chain management cases, specifically purchasing, operations, and logistics problems.
SCM470.prerequisite: (SCM 371 and SCM 372 and SCM 373) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
SCM470.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM471.name: Advanced Supply Chain Project Management
SCM471.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM471.description: Project management concepts related to planning, execution, and control of projects in supply chain environments.
SCM471.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM472.name: Supply Chain Industry Applications
SCM472.description: Integrated analysis and problem solving of supply chain management applications in collaboration with Engineering. Purchasing, manufacturing, logistics, and transportation as an integrated supply chain.
SCM472.prerequisite: (SCM 371 and SCM 372 and SCM 373) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
SCM472.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management.

SCM474.name: Negotiations
SCM474.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM474.description: Strategic negotiation, negotiation preparation, buyer-supplier relationship assessment, international negotiations, and negotiation simulation.
SCM474.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major or approval of department.

SCM475.name: Supply Chain Decision Modeling
SCM475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM475.description: Decision modeling in supply chains with emphasis on forecasting, aggregate planning, material requirement planning, inventory management, transportation, supply network design, quality management, and sourcing decisions. Use of traditional and advanced spreadsheet modeling tools.
SCM475.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management major.

SCM476.name: Transportation Management
SCM476.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM476.description: Current issues and strategies in transportation management and policy. Carrier management problems and opportunities, and economic characteristics of the various modes of transportation.
SCM476.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM479.name: Supply Chain Cost Management
SCM479.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM479.description: Pricing and cost management basics, cost models, parametric cost modeling, process mapping for cost management, total cost of ownership, target costing for purchased materials, value analysis and value engineering, using cost analysis to support purchase negotiations, current trends in cost management.
SCM479.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM490.name: Independent Study
SCM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM490.description: Supervised program of independent library or field research designed to supplement classroom study.

SCM490H.name: Honors Independent Study
SCM490H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM490H.description: Supervised program of library or field research designed to supplement classroom study

SCM491.name: Topics in Supply Chain Management
SCM491.description: Advanced aspects of supply continuity and supply risk, environmentally friendly manufacturing, total quality management, supply chain metrics, electronic markets, relationship management, interfaces with research and development, innovation and other current issues in supply chain management.

SCM800.name: Supply Chain Management
SCM800.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM800.description: Fundamentals of materials and logistics management. Strategic impact of the transformation process in a global economy. Quality, inventory management, logistics strategy, customer service, international procurement, management of technology.
SCM800.restrictions: Open to graduate students and not open to students in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or in the Supply Chain Management major.

SCM815.name: Emerging Topics in Supply Management
SCM815.description: Perspectives on new and emerging issues of supply management. Topics vary.
SCM815.restrictions: Open to MBA students and open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major or approval of department.

SCM816.name: Emerging Topics in Operations Management
SCM816.description: Perspectives on new and emerging issues in operations management. Topics vary.
SCM816.restrictions: Open to MBA students and open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major or approval of department.

SCM817.name: Emerging Topics in Logistics Management
SCM817.description: Perspectives on new and emerging issues in logistics management. Topics vary.
SCM817.restrictions: Open to MBA students and open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major or approval of department.

SCM825.name: Strategic Sourcing
SCM825.description: Strategic sourcing process. Opportunity assessment, spend and requirements analysis, supply market analysis, category sourcing strategy development and implementation. Supplier evaluation and selection.
SCM825.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM826.name: Manufacturing Design and Analysis
SCM826.description: Designing and analyzing operations processes. Capacity planning and management, process flow and mapping, value-mapping, quality tools and techniques, dependent demand inventory techniques. Recent developments and data.
SCM826.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM827.name: Competing Through Supply Chain Logistics
SCM827.description: Logistics as a value-adding process that synchronizes demand and supply. Supply chain logistics strategy, information technology, segmental positioning, forecasting and collaborative planning, and customer accommodation.
SCM827.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM833.name: Decision Support Models
SCM833.description: Analytical models to support decision making with specific supply chain focus. Topics include multiple regression, linear optimization, decisions under uncertainty, and forecasting.

SCM834.name: Supply Chain Simulation
SCM834.description: Simulation models to support decision making with specific supply chain focus. Simulation concepts, programming, design methods, and results interpretation.

SCM842.name: Total Quality Management
SCM842.description: Total quality management principles and practices, tools and techniques, implementation of continuous quality improvement programs, links to manufacturing and competitive strategies. Six Sigma and statistical quality control.

SCM843.name: Sustainable Supply Chain Management
SCM843.description: Sustainability within business and supply chain contexts. Balancing ecology/waste, economy, and equity. Supply chain sustainability from design and resource management through transformation processes, to delivery to the final customer.

SCM848.name: Analysis of Supply Markets and Suppliers
SCM848.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM848.description: Methods for supply market analysis to support sourcing strategy development, contract negotiations and cost management initiatives. Analysis of supply market conditions and structure. Buyer and supplier power. Supply risk. Benchmarking. Value analysis and value engineering.
SCM848.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM852.name: Supply Management
SCM852.description: Procurement and supply management. Insourcing and outsourcing decisions. Global sourcing. Supply chain risk management. Cost analysis and management tools. Purchase negotiation, contract management and purchasing ethics. Supplier relationship management and supplier development.
SCM852.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM853.name: Operations Strategy
SCM853.description: Developing and implementing operations strategy. Matching of competitive priorities with operational investments and decisions. Manufacturing process choice, capability development, technology management, process simulation, linking supply chain with product type and inventory management decisions. Recent developments such as synchronized flow management, E-commerce, and advanced performance measurement.
SCM853.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM854.name: Integrated Logistics Systems
SCM854.description: Logistics systems and operations that achieve synchronized demand and supply. Transportation, inventory analysis, warehousing, materials handling, and logistics network design. Integrated performance measurement and organizational structure.
SCM854.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM855.name: Supply Chain Management Technology and Applications I
SCM855.description: Integration of logistics, procurement, and operations strategy in the supply chain. Problem solving approaches, decision support tools, and analytical methods. Applications through case studies and computer simulations of supply chain situations in consumer and industrial settings.
SCM855.prerequisite: SCM 852 and SCM 853 and SCM 854 or approval of department
SCM855.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM856.name: Supply Chain Management Technology and Applications II
SCM856.description: Integration of logistics, procurement, and operations strategy in the supply chain. Problem solving approaches, decision support tools, and analytical methods. Applications through case studies and computer simulations of supply chain situations in consumer and industrial settings.
SCM856.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

SCM860.name: Procurement Contracting
SCM860.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM860.description: Workshop in procurement contracting including terms and conditions, legal terms and conditions, and contracting negotiation
SCM860.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM861.name: Customs, Compliance and Security
SCM861.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM861.description: Workshop in customs including the role of customs and border protection, supply security programs, export programs and tariffs, brokers, and trusted traders.
SCM861.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM869.name: Service Supply Chains
SCM869.description: Service supply chains. Application of supply chain principles in a service environment. Service design and resource management. Management of the transformation processes. Management of delivery to the final customer.

SCM870.name: Introduction to Supply Chain Management
SCM870.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM870.description: Integrated view of procurement, operations, and logistics management. Management of the flow of products from raw material sourcing and acquisition through delivery to the final customer.
SCM870.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major. Approval of department.

SCM871.name: Applied Data Analysis
SCM871.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM871.description: Quantitative and statistical methods for decision making. Hypothesis testing, regression and correlation analysis, forecasting, linear programming, decision analysis, and project management.
SCM871.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM872.name: Distribution Fulfillment
SCM872.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM872.description: Management of the firm's value-creation process from product development through order receipt and delivery to consumer. Alternative approaches to developing customer value and the role of the demand and supply chain in providing it.
SCM872.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM874.name: Total Quality Management and Lean Enterprise
SCM874.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM874.description: Total quality management and lean enterprise principles, practices, and techniques. Implementation of quality and lean enterprise improvement programs. Relationship to manufacturing and competitive strategies.
SCM874.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM875.name: Manufacturing Planning and Control
SCM875.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM875.description: Planning and control functions required to match supply and demand in a manufacturing firm. Tools and methods for planning production and the resources and capacity needed to support production. Role of information and information systems in planning and control. Coordination of plans across organizations supply chain.
SCM875.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM876.name: Logistics Operations Methods and Systems
SCM876.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM876.description: Micro-analysis of logistics and transportation services including customer service and order fulfillment, distribution operations, purchasing or operation of transportation services, third-party logistics providers, and network design.
SCM876.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM879.name: Supply Chain Management-Strategy and Applications
SCM879.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM879.description: Analysis and solution of supply chain management cases and simulations. Teamwork, communication, and job skills. Situations involving purchasing, manufacturing, logistics and transportation as an integrated supply chain.
SCM879.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM881.name: Global Supply Chain Management
SCM881.description: Requirements for global operations and strategy development. Similarities and differences of international and domestic supply chain operations.
SCM881.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM882.name: Supply Chain Management Project Management Research Paper
SCM882.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCM882.description: Practical application of course material to a problem or situation in the student's organization. Development of project management skills and application with other course material to a situation in the student's organization.
SCM882.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Supply Chain Management or in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM883.name: Technology and Product Innovation Management
SCM883.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM883.description: Management of technology and product development for high technology firms. Creating new product ideas, designing high technology products, managing cross-functional teams, developing and implementing marketing plans, interpreting marketing data, sales forecasting for new products, testing new products, assessing competitive dynamics, and coping with uncertain environmental forces.
SCM883.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM886.name: Strategic Sourcing
SCM886.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM886.description: Fundamentals of strategic sourcing and supply chain management. Integration and coordination of product innovation, sourcing, manufacturing, distribution, and logistics for global competitiveness.
SCM886.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM887.name: Packaging Design/Engineering Optimization in Supply Chain
SCM887.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM887.description: Overview of engineering and packaging functions that directly affect supply chain efficiency and functionality. Familiarize students with tools to solve supply chain based engineering and packaging applications.
SCM887.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major. Approval of department.

SCM888.name: Product Protection and Safety for Supply Chain Managers
SCM888.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM888.description: Introduction to general issues related to product safety and protection and how these problems affect supply chain management. Foundational discussion of brand protection, anti-counterfeiting, and food safety requirements and challenges.
SCM888.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major. Approval of department.

SCM889.name: Brand Protection for Supply Chain Managers
SCM889.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM889.description: Introduction to general issues related to product counterfeiting and how the problem affects supply chain professionals. Foundational principles of brand protection activities as carried out through the supply chain functions of brand owners.
SCM889.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management Major.

SCM890.name: Independent Study
SCM890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

SCM910.name: Supply Chain Theory
SCM910.description: Seminar in supply chain theory, history and development.
SCM910.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.

SCM916.name: Supply Chain Statistical Research Methods
SCM916.description: Statistical research methods and techniques to support supply chain management empirical research. Applications of statistical methods drawn from current literature in procurement, operations management, and logistics.
SCM916.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

SCM917.name: Supply Chain Applied Decision Models
SCM917.description: Linear and non-linear optimization models. Linear programming, integer programming, goal programming, multi-criteria models, and non-linear programing (constrained and unconstrained optimization). Problem formulation and solution procedures.
SCM917.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

SCM918.name: Procurement and Sourcing Theory
SCM918.description: Theoretical models explaining procurement and sourcing strategy. Frameworks to guide research.

SCM923.name: Topics in Operations Management
SCM923.description: Current research in the field. Topics vary.

SCM930.name: Foundations in Logistics Research
SCM930.description: Development and management of firm logistics systems within the context of an integrated supply chain strategy. Explores foundational research in the logistics management field.

SCM931.name: Simulation Methods for Business Research
SCM931.description: Techniques and methodology for system design and policy formulation. Methodological focus on simulation and analytical techniques to develop empirical results documenting current and anticipated system performance.
SCM931.prerequisite: MGT 906 or SCM 916 or approval of department

SCM932.name: Emerging Thought and Current Trends in Logistics
SCM932.description: Development and management of opportunities and challenges related to the financial and service implications of designing and delivering logistical solutions in global markets. Policy and business elements affecting strategic outsourcing, supply chain relationship management, global compliance, business analytics, and the use of information technology and decision support systems.

SCM941.name: Seminar on Empirical Research
SCM941.description: Empirical research published in the field of operations and sourcing management.

SCM942.name: Seminar on Analytical Research
SCM942.description: Analytical research published in the field of operations and sourcing management.

SCM990.name: Independent Study
SCM990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM990.description: Intensive reading and research on a supply chain topic of mutual interest to a faculty member and a doctoral student.
SCM990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Supply Chain Management.

SCM995.name: Directed Research Paper
SCM995.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM995.description: Production of research paper under the direction of a senior faculty member
SCM995.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Supply Chain Management.

SCM999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
SCM999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCM999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Supply Chain Management or approval of department.
